intro: Eriosema griseum var. togense, commonly known as the Togian eriosema, is a flowering plant native to the Togian Islands in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in racemes, which are often clustered at the leaf axils. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate in shape and are covered with fine, silky hairs, contributing to its common name. This species is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique morphology and limited geographic distribution.
